question: Which countries share the habitat of the indigenous "Ch'orti' people"?
option4: Costa Rica, Honduras and El Salvador
explanation: Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador are the countries that share the habitat of the indigenous "Ch'orti' people". The Ch'orti' people are one of the indigenous Maya peoples, who primarily reside in communities and towns of southeastern Guatemala, northwestern Honduras, and northern El Salvador. Their indigenous language, also known as Ch'orti', is survival of Classic Choltian, the language of the inscriptions in Copan.
